title: Hello!
text:
I am a researcher at the Tax Policy Center at the Urban Institute.
I work on microsimulation modeling, quantitative analysis, and data visualization, focusing on refundable tax credits for low-income families and children, and the interplay between federal, state, and local tax and budget policy.
I’m excited about blending subject matter knowledge and code-first data science methods to build better tools and workflows for tax researchers.
Outside of work I can be found geeking out about public transit or at a movie theater.

title: About
text:
I’m an experienced policy data analyst and research programmer interested in direct cash assistance and fiscal federalism. I’m excited about using code-first data science methods to improve and make research workflows reproducible.
In my current role at the Urban Institute, I have a wide policy research and project management portfolio that includes analyzing federal tax policy using the Tax Policy Center Microsimulation Model and applying data privacy methods to administrative tax data.
Prior to joining Urban, I studied economics at Reed College where I also worked as a research assistant, and was an Equity & Policy Intern using research to support housing policy implementation at the Portland Housing Bureau.

Experience

Urban Institute, Research Associate, July 2019-present
Reed College, Research Assistant, Summer 2018
Portland Housing Bureau, Equity & Policy Intern, September 2017-June 2018



Education
Reed College BA in Economics, 2019
